title: The Phinney Phantom
description: A mysterious figure known as the Phinney Phantom has been leaving puzzles around Phinney Ridge. Follow the trail, solve each clue, and uncover what they’re trying to reveal.
hunt_intro_text:
Welcome to the **Neighborhood Investigations Bureau**. We look into the small mysteries most people overlook.

Lately, someone calling themselves the **Phinney Phantom** has been leaving strange clues in familiar places around Phinney Ridge. Each one leads to another location and puzzle, but our team stalled while following the trail. We need fresh eyes.

This morning, a new note appeared at the Phinney Center that matches the Phantom’s earlier work. It looks like an invitation.

{{handwritten}}I need someone more clever,
Someone who won’t be vexed.
Find and solve the first puzzle,
I’ll show you where to go next.
— PP
{{/handwritten}}

This is your case now. Follow the Phantom’s trail, solve what they’ve left behind, and see where it leads.

locations.name: Phinney Center
locations.location_riddle: You start by searching around the **Phinney Center** for the puzzle the Phantom mentioned.
locations.location_found_text:
In the bushes nearby, you find a small lockbox with a note attached. It looks like a clue to the combination.

{{handwritten}}You may *address* me as the Phinney Phantom.
I’ll start you off with something plain:
The lock opens with the numbers
That mark your place upon this lane.
{{/handwritten}}

locations.name: Sully's Snow Goose Saloon
locations.location_riddle:
You enter the address of the Phinney Center into the lock, and it springs open! Inside is another piece of paper. You unfold it and read:

{{handwritten}}So you accepted my challenge,
Unpacked what I hid.
Looking for more clues?
Leave here and go south.
Take the first letters,
Spell out your next stop.
{{/handwritten}}

Whatever the Phantom is pointing to, it’s not here. You’ll need to head to the next location to continue the investigation.
locations.location_found_text:
You head down the street and step into **Sully’s Snow Goose Saloon** to see what the Phantom has left for you here. The bartender notices you looking around, slides a small safe across the counter, and nods toward it.

“We found this outside last night,” he says. “Maybe you can make some sense of it.”

Attached is another note.

{{handwritten}}The street to the south,
Then half the street to the north.
The numbers flanking the door
Are the third and the fourth.
{{/handwritten}}

locations.name: Heart of Phinney Park
locations.location_riddle:
You notice the two 12s on the ground outside Sully’s and enter the combination into the safe: 61-31-12-12. The handle turns and the safe clicks open.

Inside is yet another note:
{{handwritten}}Head north for five blocks,
Near where you found your first clue.
A silent tower watches over
Three tables of checkered blue.
{{/handwritten}}

Wherever this “silent tower” is, it sounds like your next stop to search for more clues.
locations.location_found_text:
The **Heart of Phinney Park** is quiet, tucked just north of the Phinney Center you visited earlier. A tall, silent tower rises above the trees, watching over a handful of outdoor chess tables.

As you look around, you spot a small control panel tucked beneath a bench. Four colored buttons sit in a row, waiting.

A folded note rests beside it:
{{handwritten}}Search around for four colors,
Enter them just as I will:
The siren,
The tower,
B6,
Then the mill.
{{/handwritten}}

locations.name: Greenwood Hardware
locations.location_riddle:
As you enter the final color, the panel responds with a soft click. One of its seams opens just enough for a folded note to slip free.

You take it and read:
{{handwritten}}Where tools line the walls,
And home fixes begin.
Keys, paint, and screws
Wait patiently within.
{{/handwritten}}

It sounds like the Phantom wants you to pay a visit to another place in the neighborhood.
locations.location_found_text:
You stop outside **Greenwood Hardware**, the windows packed full of merchandise and posters, as usual.

As you look around, you spot a small metal box tucked near the sidewalk, its face covered in sliding tiles. There’s no note this time, but you can guess that this is another puzzle from the Phantom.

locations.name: Phinney Books
locations.location_riddle:
As the last tile clicks into place, the box gives a soft metallic snap.

The front panel drops open just enough to reveal a familiar scrap of paper inside.

{{handwritten}}Head north up the street,
You will pass along the way:
a house of engines, a hall of steins,
A place where beans are ground each day.

Near a bar named for a road,
Windows framed in red and blue,
A cozy home of stories waits,
Outside will be your next clue.
{{/handwritten}}
locations.location_found_text:
You arrive outside **Phinney Books**, its front windows packed tight with the book display of the month.

Just off to the side, near the entrance, you spot a small lettered cryptex resting where it doesn’t quite belong. A note is tied to it:
{{handwritten}}Peer in through the windows,
Or poke your head in the door.
On the north wall there’s a sign,
A word of golden letters four.
{{/handwritten}}

locations.name: Ken's Market
locations.location_riddle:
The cryptex clicks and comes apart in your hands. Inside is a small strip of paper, rolled tight.
{{handwritten}}One more stop to go,
Head back the way you came.
You’ve already passed it —
Groceries sold in a man’s name.{{/handwritten}}

Sounds like the Phantom is sending you back down the street for one final clue.
locations.location_found_text:
You head down the street to **Ken’s Market**, just as the note suggested.

Along the side of the building, you notice a small frame set near the wall. Inside are three picture tiles, out of order. It doesn’t take much guessing to figure out who left this behind, or what you need to do.

hunt_success_text:
As the last tile slides into place, the frame gives a soft click.

The backing loosens and drops away, revealing a final folded note tucked inside.

{{handwritten}}You scoured the Ridge,
You followed my trail.
Now it’s time for me
To lift up my veil.

I’m just one of you—
A neighbor, a friend.
Someone who doesn’t want
The charm of this place to end

I left you these stops
So they wouldn’t be lost,
These spots need to be remembered
No matter the cost.

So look a little closer,
These locations weren’t random.
They’re what makes this place special.
Sincerely, **The Phinney Phantom**
{{/handwritten}}

Back at the Phinney Center, you check in with the Neighborhood Investigations Bureau. There’s no Phantom to arrest, but the trail makes sense now.

Case closed.
